column4: I had a problem earlier because im trying to install ubuntu 64-bit 10.10 on windows 7 64bit host with an intel t4400 dual-core processor and was referred to the forums but no solutions have worked =|
vbox
sorry
virtualbox
try enabling virtualization in your BIOS settings
When I try to boot the ubuntu image, it says it detects my processor as i686 instead of x86
wi tried
theres no virtualization setting in bios
and i just updated it to the latest bios version
flashed it etc
are you sure your processor supports virtualization?
in settings of what?
it says my processor doesnt have vt-x, am I doomed for ANY kind of virtualization
or can i use wubi/vm etc
not any kind, but try running 32-bit Ubuntu
intel
well i kinda wanted the 64bit ubuntu because im going to be developing ruby on rails apps and sites on there :(
there's really not a whole lot of difference in the user experience between 32 and 64 bit
alrighty, thanks for the help guys
esp. in a VM
